sense.name: Disturb the smoothness of
sense.examples: The wind rumpled the surface of the water. Now the gravest Minister shall be rumpled by an insulting Prelate. The strong wind rumpled my hair. My son rumpled the papers on my desk. The bird's feathers were all rumpled.

sense.name: Wrinkled, crumpled, or creased.
sense.examples: This fabric won't rumple. She rumpled her face in disgust. The sheets were rumpled.
